channel.title: CVE Feed for PowerDNS -- pdns
channel.description: The latest CVEs for PowerDNS -- pdns

item.title: CVE-2019-10163|2024-08-04T22:10:10.003Z -- powerdns -- pdns
item.description: A Vulnerability has been found in PowerDNS Authoritative Server before versions 4.1.9, 4.0.8 allowing a remote, authorized master server to cause a high CPU load or even prevent any further updates to any slave zone by sending a large number of NOTIFY messages. Note that only servers configured as slaves are affected by this issue.

item.title: CVE-2019-10162|2024-08-04T22:10:10.028Z -- powerdns -- pdns
item.description: A vulnerability has been found in PowerDNS Authoritative Server before versions 4.1.10, 4.0.8 allowing an authorized user to cause the server to exit by inserting a crafted record in a MASTER type zone under their control. The issue is due to the fact that the Authoritative Server will exit when it runs into a parsing error while looking up the NS/A/AAAA records it is about to use for an outgoing notify.
